values.authorQuote: Patience is not simply the ability to wait - it's how we behave while we're waiting.
values.author: Joyce Meyer

values.authorQuote: You cannot have a positive life and a negative mind.
values.author: Joyce Meyer

values.authorQuote: I believe that the greatest gift you can give your family and the world is a healthy you.
values.author: Joyce Meyer

values.authorQuote: I may not be where I want to be, but thank God I am not where I used to be.
values.author: Joyce Meyer

values.authorQuote: I believe that a trusting attitude and a patient attitude go hand in hand. You see, when you let go and learn to trust God, it releases joy in your life. And when you trust God, you're able to be more patient. Patience is not just about waiting for something... it's about how you wait, or your attitude while waiting.
values.author: Joyce Meyer

values.authorQuote: Consider a tree for a moment. As beautiful as trees are to look at, we don't see what goes on underground - as they grow roots. Trees must develop deep roots in order to grow strong and produce their beauty. But we don't see the roots. We just see and enjoy the beauty. In much the same way, what goes on inside of us is like the roots of a tree.
values.author: Joyce Meyer

values.authorQuote: God's mercy is fresh and new every morning.
values.author: Joyce Meyer

values.authorQuote: When you begin to worry, go find something to do. Get busy being a blessing to someone; do something fruitful. Talking about your problem or sitting alone, thinking about it, does no good; it serves only to make you miserable. Above all else, remember that worrying is totally useless. Worrying will not solve your problem.
values.author: Joyce Meyer

values.authorQuote: Depression begins with disappointment. When disappointment festers in our soul, it leads to discouragement.
values.author: Joyce Meyer

values.authorQuote: The eagle has no fear of adversity. We need to be like the eagle and have a fearless spirit of a conqueror!
values.author: Joyce Meyer

values.authorQuote: I've been saying for a couple of years now that people need to let God out of the Sunday morning box, that He doesn't want to just be with you for an hour or two on Sunday morning and then put back in His box to sit there until you have an emergency, but He wants to invade your Monday, Tuesday, Wednesday, Thursday, Friday, Saturday, and Sunday.
values.author: Joyce Meyer

values.authorQuote: No matter what has happened to you in the past or what is going on in your life right now, it has no power to keep you from having an amazingly good future if you will walk by faith in God. God loves you! He wants you to live with victory over sin so you can possess His promises for your life today!
values.author: Joyce Meyer

values.authorQuote: There's no happier person than a truly thankful, content person.
values.author: Joyce Meyer

values.authorQuote: Teachers can change lives with just the right mix of chalk and challenges.
values.author: Joyce Meyer

values.authorQuote: Many people feel so pressured by the expectations of others that it causes them to be frustrated, miserable and confused about what they should do. But there is a way to live a simple, joy-filled, peaceful life, and the key is learning how to be led by the Holy Spirit, not the traditions or expectations of man.
values.author: Joyce Meyer

values.authorQuote: If someone decides they're not going to be happy, it's not your problem. You don't have to spend your time and energy trying to cheer up someone who has already decided to stay in a bad mood. Believe it or not, you can actually hurt people by playing into their self-pity.
values.author: Joyce Meyer

values.authorQuote: Instead of being critical of people in authority over you and envious of their position, be happy you're not responsible for everything they have to do. Instead of piling on complaints, thank them for what they do. Overwhelm them with encouragement and appreciation!
values.author: Joyce Meyer

values.authorQuote: At school I pretended I had a normal life, but I felt lonely all the time and different from everyone else. I never felt like I fit in, and I wasn't allowed to participate in after-school activities, go to sports events or parties or date boys. Many times I had to make up stories about why I couldn't do anything with my classmates.
values.author: Joyce Meyer

values.authorQuote: Getting stress out of your life takes more than prayer alone. You must take action to make changes and stop doing whatever is causing the stress. You can learn to calm down in the way you handle things.
values.author: Joyce Meyer

values.authorQuote: A #2 pencil and a dream can take you anywhere.
values.author: Joyce Meyer

values.authorQuote: God's grace is amazing! We're saved by grace - God's undeserved favor - and we live by grace, which is also God's power in our lives to do what we could never do in our own strength. And it's all because God is love, and He loves us unconditionally, constantly and completely.
values.author: Joyce Meyer

values.authorQuote: Each time we cooperate with God, we take one more giant step forward. Because when God asks us to change, it means that He always has something better to give us - more freedom, greater joy, and greater blessings.
values.author: Joyce Meyer

values.authorQuote: Over the years, I've learned that a confident person doesn't concentrate or focus on their weaknesses - they maximize their strengths.
values.author: Joyce Meyer

values.authorQuote: Spending time with God through prayer and His Word is a prerequisite for having a great life and fulfilling your purpose.
values.author: Joyce Meyer

values.authorQuote: I want to let you in on a little secret: I don't always feel like I'm a success. That's right. There are plenty of times when I feel like I've just totally messed up and failed to connect with the people I'm trying to communicate with.
values.author: Joyce Meyer

values.authorQuote: The Bible says to 'fear not,' but this doesn't mean you should never feel scared. It means when you do feel fear, keep going forward and do what you are supposed to do. Or as I like to say, do it afraid.

values.authorQuote: The secret of a happy marriage is finding the right person. You know they're right if you love to be with them all the time.
values.author: Julia Child

values.authorQuote: In France, cooking is a serious art form and a national sport.
values.author: Julia Child

values.authorQuote: Usually, one's cooking is better than one thinks it is.
values.author: Julia Child

values.authorQuote: Because of media hype and woefully inadequate information, too many people nowadays are deathly afraid of their food, and what does fear of food do to the digestive system? I am sure that an unhappy or suspicious stomach, constricted and uneasy with worry, cannot digest properly.
values.author: Julia Child

values.authorQuote: Find something you're passionate about and keep tremendously interested in it.
values.author: Julia Child

values.authorQuote: It's so beautifully arranged on the plate - you know someone's fingers have been all over it.
values.author: Julia Child

values.authorQuote: Once you have mastered a technique, you hardly need look at a recipe again and can take off on your own.
values.author: Julia Child

values.authorQuote: As we say in the American Institute of Wine and Food, small helpings, no seconds. A little bit of everything. No snacking. And have a good time.
values.author: Julia Child

values.authorQuote: In my generation, except for a few people who'd gone into banking or nursing or something like that, middle-class women didn't have careers. You were to marry and have children and be a nice mother. You didn't go out and do anything. I found that I got restless.
values.author: Julia Child

values.authorQuote: Life itself is the proper binge.
values.author: Julia Child

values.authorQuote: To be able to serve and to eat a whole fish, especially a trout, is part of civilized dining. This applies particularly to the young, who should take to it as soon as they can handle knife and fork; this is a fine way for them to begin taking pride in themselves and their abilities.
values.author: Julia Child

values.authorQuote: I think careful cooking is love, don't you? The loveliest thing you can cook for someone who's close to you is about as nice a valentine as you can give.
values.author: Julia Child

values.authorQuote: Because I've done a lot of television, I'm sort of a generalist. I'm not a pastry cook, but I've had to learn a certain amount about it. I'm not a baker, though I've had to learn how to do it. I'm sort of a general cook.
values.author: Julia Child

values.authorQuote: I think one of the terrible things today is that people have this deathly fear of food: fear of eggs, say, or fear of butter. Most doctors feel that you can have a little bit of everything.
values.author: Julia Child

values.authorQuote: Animals that we eat are raised for food in the most economical way possible, and the serious food producers do it in the most humane way possible. I think anyone who is a carnivore needs to understand that meat does not originally come in these neat little packages.
values.author: Julia Child

values.authorQuote: In the 1970s we got nouvelle cuisine, in which a lot of the old rules were kicked over. And then we had cuisine minceur, which people mixed up with nouvelle cuisine but was actually fancy diet cooking.
values.author: Julia Child

values.authorQuote: In the 1960s, you could eat anything you wanted, and of course, people were smoking cigarettes and all kinds of things, and there was no talk about fat and anything like that, and butter and cream were rife. Those were lovely days for gastronomy, I must say.
values.author: Julia Child

values.authorQuote: When I got to France I realized I didn't know very much about food at all. I'd never had a real cake. I'd had those cakes from cake mixes or the ones that have a lot of baking powder in them. A really good French cake doesn't have anything like that in it - it's all egg power.
values.author: Julia Child

values.authorQuote: Drama is very important in life: You have to come on with a bang. You never want to go out with a whimper. Everything can have drama if it's done right. Even a pancake.
values.author: Julia Child

values.authorQuote: I was 32 when I started cooking; up until then, I just ate.
values.author: Julia Child

values.authorQuote: You learn to cook so that you don't have to be a slave to recipes. You get what's in season and you know what to do with it.
values.author: Julia Child

values.authorQuote: I had my first French meal and I never got over it. It was just marvelous. We had oysters and a lovely dry white wine. And then we had one of those lovely scalloped dishes and the lovely, creamery buttery sauce. Then we had a roast duck and I don't know what else.
values.author: Julia Child

values.authorQuote: I wouldn't keep him around long if I didn't feed him well.
values.author: Julia Child

values.authorQuote: I was never a spy. I was with the OSS organization. We had a number of women, but we were all office help.
values.author: Julia Child

values.authorQuote: I found that the recipes in most - in all - the books I had were really not adequate. They didn't tell you enough... I won't do anything unless I'm told why I'm doing it. So I felt that we needed fuller explanations so that if you followed one of those recipes, it should turn out exactly right.
values.author: Julia Child

values.authorQuote: In department stores, so much kitchen equipment is bought indiscriminately by people who just come in for men's underwear.
values.author: Julia Child

values.authorQuote: Men freely believe that which they desire.

values.authorQuote: Men are nearly always willing to believe what they wish.

values.authorQuote: I have always reckoned the dignity of the republic of first importance and preferable to life.

values.authorQuote: Fortune, which has a great deal of power in other matters but especially in war, can bring about great changes in a situation through very slight forces.
values.author: Julius Caesar

I was only 12 and I got second place.

values.authorQuote: I think I'm probably gonna quit music.

values.authorQuote: Everybody wants to be famous, but nobody wants to do the work. I live by that. You grind hard so you can play hard. At the end of the day, you put all the work in, and eventually it'll pay off. It could be in a year, it could be in 30 years. Eventually, your hard work will pay off.
values.author: Kevin Hart

values.authorQuote: Laughter heals all wounds, and that's one thing that everybody shares. No matter what you're going through, it makes you forget about your problems. I think the world should keep laughing.

values.authorQuote: I get that racism exists, but it's not a catalyst for my content. I don't need to talk about race to have material. My style of comedy is more self-deprecating. I think that makes me more relatable. When you deal with 'topics' - race, white versus black - you're not separating from the pack. You're doing what everybody else is doing.
values.author: Kevin Hart

values.authorQuote: Success isn't supposed to happen, no matter how hard you work. There's no guarantee you're going to succeed. There's nothing set in stone.

values.authorQuote: My experiences in life are getting bigger and better. The more stuff I do, the more stuff I talk about - having kids, traveling, going through relationship problems, dealing with things in my own family. All that stuff builds character.

values.authorQuote: Stand-up can take you in so many different places, man. So many doors can be opened up from stand-up comedy, and the first one that was opened up for me was acting. But you can go from acting to being a TV personality to being a radio personality to being a writer to being a producer, to just being a visionary, to voiceover work.
values.author: Kevin Hart

values.authorQuote: Men are like lions. We hunt.

values.authorQuote: As a producer, as a CEO of Hartbeat Productions, I am making deals to put my company in place to win, to put my staff to work so that while all this stuff is going on, they're in the kitchen cooking. values.authorQuote: You definitely want your kids to understand their heritage, but I don't want my kids to just focus on being black. They are people. values.authorQuote: People don't want drama 365 days a year. I'm a sense of relief; it's my job to take your mind off what's bad for that brief second you're in the room with me, regardless of shape, race, colour or anything. It brings people together, and it makes me feel good about what I'm doing.

values.authorQuote: My main goal is to be a self-made man and have control over what's mine.

values.authorQuote: A reputation as a hard worker is a good reputation to have.

values.authorQuote: Faith is a knowledge within the heart, beyond the reach of proof.

values.authorOccupation: Poet, painter, writer, philosopher, theologian, visual artist
values.authorBirthplace: Bsharri, Mount Lebanon Mutasarrifate, Ottoman Syria

values.authorQuote: Your daily life is your temple and your religion. When you enter into it take with you your all.

values.authorOccupation: Poet, painter, writer, philosopher, theologian, visual artist
values.authorBirthplace: Bsharri, Mount Lebanon Mutasarrifate, Ottoman Syria

values.authorQuote: When you are joyous, look deep into your heart and you shall find it is only that which has given you sorrow that is giving you joy. When you are sorrowful look again in your heart, and you shall see that in truth you are weeping for that which has been your delight.
values.author: Khalil Gibran
values.authorOccupation: Poet, painter, writer, philosopher, theologian, visual artist
values.authorBirthplace: Bsharri, Mount Lebanon Mutasarrifate, Ottoman Syria

values.authorQuote: March on. Do not tarry. To go forward is to move toward perfection. March on, and fear not the thorns, or the sharp stones on life's path.
values.author: Khalil Gibran
values.authorOccupation: Poet, painter, writer, philosopher, theologian, visual artist
values.authorBirthplace: Bsharri, Mount Lebanon Mutasarrifate, Ottoman Syria

values.authorQuote: Keep me away from the wisdom which does not cry, the philosophy which does not laugh and the greatness which does not bow before children.
values.author: Khalil Gibran
values.authorOccupation: Poet, painter, writer, philosopher, theologian, visual artist
values.authorBirthplace: Bsharri, Mount Lebanon Mutasarrifate, Ottoman Syria

values.authorQuote: If you reveal your secrets to the wind, you should not blame the wind for revealing them to the trees.
values.author: Khalil Gibran
values.authorOccupation: Poet, painter, writer, philosopher, theologian, visual artist
values.authorBirthplace: Bsharri, Mount Lebanon Mutasarrifate, Ottoman Syria

values.authorQuote: Your living is determined not so much by what life brings to you as by the attitude you bring to life; not so much by what happens to you as by the way your mind looks at what happens.
values.author: Khalil Gibran
values.authorOccupation: Poet, painter, writer, philosopher, theologian, visual artist
values.authorBirthplace: Bsharri, Mount Lebanon Mutasarrifate, Ottoman Syria

values.authorQuote: If in the twilight of memory we should meet once more, we shall speak again together and you shall sing to me a deeper song.
values.author: Khalil Gibran

values.authorBirthplace: Bsharri, Mount Lebanon Mutasarrifate, Ottoman Syria

So you do the work, whether it's fitness or whatever. It's about getting up, motivating yourself and just doing it.

values.authorQuote: Meeting people at my fertility doctor's office who are going through the same things I'm going through, I thought, 'Why not share my story?' It's been really emotional.

values.authorOccupation: Television personality, socialite, actress, businesswoman, model

values.authorQuote: I've made mistakes in my life for sure.
values.author: Kim Kardashian
values.authorOccupation: Television personality, socialite, actress, businesswoman, model

values.authorQuote: You make mistakes, but I don't have any regrets. I'm the kind of person who takes responsibility for it and deals with it. I learn from everything I do. I work very hard, I have so many things going on in my life. Get to know me and see who I am.

values.authorOccupation: Television personality, socialite, actress, businesswoman, model

values.authorQuote: I am so stereotyped into being this Hollywood girl.

values.authorOccupation: Television personality, socialite, actress, businesswoman, model

values.authorQuote: Personally, I've always loved the curvy look.
values.author: Kim Kardashian
values.authorOccupation: Television personality, socialite, actress, businesswoman, model

values.authorQuote: Maybe my fairy tale has a different ending than I dreamed it would. But that's OK.
values.author: Kim Kardashian
values.authorOccupation: Television personality, socialite, actress, businesswoman, model

values.authorQuote: I'm a really nostalgic person. I love taking photos and video and having memories. I remember all my childhood videos that my dad used to take. I think that's really what life is about - especially when you start a family of your own.

values.authorQuote: I'm totally growing up.

values.authorQuote: Everything negative - pressure, challenges - is all an opportunity for me to rise.

values.authorQuote: Sports are such a great teacher. I think of everything they've taught me: camaraderie, humility, how to resolve differences.
values.author: Kobe Bryant

values.authorQuote: I have self-doubt. I have insecurity. I have fear of failure. I have nights when I show up at the arena and I'm like, 'My back hurts, my feet hurt, my knees hurt. I don't have it. I just want to chill.' We all have self-doubt. You don't deny it, but you also don't capitulate to it. You embrace it.
values.author: Kobe Bryant

values.authorQuote: The most important thing is to try and inspire people so that they can be great in whatever they want to do.
values.author: Kobe Bryant

values.authorQuote: Everyone looks at your watch and it represents who you are, your values and your personal style.

values.authorQuote: If you're afraid to fail, then you're probably going to fail.
values.author: Kobe Bryant

values.authorQuote: I'm chasing perfection.
values.author: Kobe Bryant

values.authorQuote: I'm here. I'm not going anywhere. No matter what the injury - unless it's completely debilitating - I'm going to be the same player I've always been. I'll figure it out. I'll make some tweaks, some changes, but I'm still coming.

values.authorQuote: People just don't understand how obsessed I am with winning.
values.author: Kobe Bryant

values.authorQuote: The important thing is that your teammates have to know you're pulling for them and you really want them to be successful.
values.author: Kobe Bryant

values.authorQuote: These young guys are playing checkers. I'm out there playing chess.
values.author: Kobe Bryant

values.authorQuote: My parents are my backbone. Still are. They're the only group that will support you if you score zero or you score 40.
values.author: Kobe Bryant

values.authorQuote: I don't talk trash often, but when I do, I go for the jugular.
values.author: Kobe Bryant

values.authorQuote: I'm extremely willful to win, and I respond to challenges. Scoring titles and stuff like that... it sounds, well, I don't care how it sounds - to me, scoring comes easy. It's not a challenge to me to win the scoring title, because I know I can.
values.author: Kobe Bryant

values.authorQuote: It never bothered me when people would say, 'You only win championships because you're playing with Shaq.' It bothered me when he said it.
values.author: Kobe Bryant

values.authorQuote: Christmas morning, I'm going to open presents with my kids. I'm going to take pictures of them opening the presents. Then I'm going to come to the Staples Center and get ready to work.
values.author: Kobe Bryant

values.authorQuote: Eeew, I'd be a little uncomfortable Googling myself. People sit there - and Google themselves? That's kind of weird.
values.author: Kobe Bryant

values.authorQuote: Winning takes precedence over all. There's no gray area. No almosts.
values.author: Kobe Bryant

values.authorQuote: I like playing for the purple and gold. This is where I want to finish up.
values.author: Kobe Bryant

values.authorQuote: The people who truly know me know what I'm like. There have been people who try to say things that aren't fair, and I check them. And then they don't like me because I checked them.
values.author: Kobe Bryant

values.authorQuote: Can I jump over two or three guys like I used to? No. Am I as fast as I used to be? No, but I still have the fundamentals and smarts. That's what enables me to still be a dominant player. As a kid growing up, I never skipped steps. I always worked on fundamentals because I know athleticism is fleeting.
values.author: Kobe Bryant

values.authorQuote: In an individual sport, yes, you have to win titles. Baseball's different. But basketball, hockey? One person can control the tempo of a game, can completely alter the momentum of a series. There's a lot of great individual talent.
values.author: Kobe Bryant

values.authorQuote: What people see on court is another side of me; it's not me.

values.authorQuote: If there were camera phones back in the day, the biggest athletes in the world would have had a lot of explaining to do.
values.author: Kobe Bryant

values.authorQuote: I don't think a coach becomes the right coach until he wins a championship.

values.authorQuote: It's different from being 21 and you think there's endless amount of opportunities. At 33, the ending is much, much closer.

values.authorQuote: I'd rather be hated for who I am, than loved for who I am not.

values.authorQuote: The duty of youth is to challenge corruption.

values.authorQuote: The sun is gone, but I have a light.

values.authorQuote: If you die you're completely happy and your soul somewhere lives on. I'm not afraid of dying. Total peace after death, becoming someone else is the best hope I've got.

values.authorQuote: My body is damaged from music in two ways. I have a red irritation in my stomach. It's psychosomatic, caused by all the anger and the screaming. I have scoliosis, where the curvature of your spine is bent, and the weight of my guitar has made it worse. I'm always in pain, and that adds to the anger in our music.
values.author: Kurt Cobain

values.authorQuote: I really haven't had that exciting of a life. There are a lot of things I wish I would have done, instead of just sitting around and complaining about having a boring life. So I pretty much like to make it up. I'd rather tell a story about somebody else.

values.authorQuote: The worst crime is faking it.
values.author: Kurt Cobain

values.authorQuote: I really miss being able to blend in with people.
values.author: Kurt Cobain

values.authorQuote: Punk is musical freedom. It's saying, doing and playing what you want. In Webster's terms, 'nirvana' means freedom from pain, suffering and the external world, and that's pretty close to my definition of Punk Rock.
values.author: Kurt Cobain

values.authorQuote: It's okay to eat fish because they don't have any feelings.
values.author: Kurt Cobain

values.authorQuote: If it's illegal to rock and roll, throw my ass in jail!
values.author: Kurt Cobain

values.authorQuote: I've never been a very prolific person, so when creativity flows, it flows. I find myself scribbling on little notepads and pieces of loose paper, which results in a very small portion of my writings to ever show up in true form.
values.author: Kurt Cobain

values.authorQuote: I'm a spokesman for myself. It just so happens that there's a bunch of people that are concerned with what I have to say. I find that frightening at times because I'm just as confused as most people. I don't have the answers for anything.
values.author: Kurt Cobain

values.authorQuote: I'm so happy because today I found my friends - they're in my head.
values.author: Kurt Cobain

values.authorQuote: I'm too busy acting like I'm not Naive. I've seen it all, I was here first.

values.authorQuote: I like to complain and do nothing to make things better.
values.author: Kurt Cobain

values.authorQuote: A friend is nothing but a known enemy.
values.author: Kurt Cobain

values.authorQuote: We're so trendy we can't even escape ourselves.
values.author: Kurt Cobain

values.authorQuote: I didn't know how to deal with success. If there was a Rock Star 101, I would have liked to take it. It might have helped me.

values.authorQuote: I was looking for something a lot heavier, yet melodic at the same time. Something different from heavy metal, a different attitude.
values.author: Kurt Cobain

values.authorQuote: I thought I would try to be gay for a while, but I'm just more sexually attracted to women. But I'm really glad that I found a few gay friends, because it totally saved me from becoming a monk or something.
values.author: Kurt Cobain

values.authorQuote: Rather be dead than cool.
values.author: Kurt Cobain

values.authorQuote: I definitely feel closer to the feminine side of the human being than I do the male - or the American idea of what a male is supposed to be. Just watch a beer commercial and you'll see what I mean.
values.author: Kurt Cobain

values.authorQuote: Drugs are a waste of time. They destroy your memory and your self-respect and everything that goes along with with your self-esteem. They're no good at all.
values.author: Kurt Cobain

values.authorQuote: Laughter and tears are both responses to frustration and exhaustion. I myself prefer to laugh, since there is less cleaning up to do afterward.
values.author: Kurt Vonnegut

values.authorQuote: True terror is to wake up one morning and discover that your high school class is running the country.
values.author: Kurt Vonnegut

values.authorQuote: We could have saved the Earth but we were too damned cheap.
values.author: Kurt Vonnegut

values.authorQuote: We are what we pretend to be, so we must be careful what we pretend to be.
values.author: Kurt Vonnegut

values.authorQuote: Maturity is a bitter disappointment for which no remedy exists, unless laughter could be said to remedy anything.
values.author: Kurt Vonnegut

values.authorQuote: About astrology and palmistry: they are good because they make people vivid and full of possibilities. They are communism at its best. Everybody has a birthday and almost everybody has a palm.
values.author: Kurt Vonnegut

values.authorQuote: Here we are, trapped in the amber of the moment. There is no why.
values.author: Kurt Vonnegut

values.authorQuote: I want to stand as close to the edge as I can without going over. Out on the edge you see all the kinds of things you can't see from the center.
values.author: Kurt Vonnegut

values.authorQuote: People aren't supposed to look back. I'm certainly not going to do it anymore.
values.author: Kurt Vonnegut

values.authorQuote: The arts are not a way to make a living. They are a very human way of making life more bearable. Practicing an art, no matter how well or badly, is a way to make your soul grow, for heaven's sake.
values.author: Kurt Vonnegut

values.authorQuote: Human beings will be happier - not when they cure cancer or get to Mars or eliminate racial prejudice or flush Lake Erie but when they find ways to inhabit primitive communities again. That's my utopia.
values.author: Kurt Vonnegut

values.authorQuote: Beware of the man who works hard to learn something, learns it, and finds himself no wiser than before.
values.author: Kurt Vonnegut

values.authorQuote: Actually, to be an effective person politically in this country, I think you have to be thirty or over, and also you have to be rich, well-placed, you have to be close to power. And I don't think that young people, because they look young, can do much, as I think they are counterproductive.
values.author: Kurt Vonnegut

values.authorQuote: I consider anybody a twerp who hasn't read 'Democracy in America' by Alexis de Tocqueville. There can never be a better book than that one on the strengths and vulnerabilities inherent in our form of government.
values.author: Kurt Vonnegut

values.authorQuote: People don't come to church for preachments, of course, but to daydream about God.
values.author: Kurt Vonnegut

values.authorQuote: Anything can make me stop and look and wonder, and sometimes learn.
values.author: Kurt Vonnegut

values.authorQuote: The universe is a big place, perhaps the biggest.
values.author: Kurt Vonnegut

values.authorQuote: If you can do a half-assed job of anything, you're a one-eyed man in a kingdom of the blind.
values.author: Kurt Vonnegut

values.authorQuote: I tell you, we are here on Earth to fart around, and don't let anybody tell you different.
values.author: Kurt Vonnegut

values.authorQuote: I let the dog out, or I let him in, and we talk some. I let him know I like him, and he lets me know he likes me.
values.author: Kurt Vonnegut

values.authorQuote: I asked myself about the present: how wide it was, how deep it was, how much was mine to keep.
values.author: Kurt Vonnegut

values.authorQuote: What should young people do with their lives today? Many things, obviously. But the most daring thing is to create stable communities in which the terrible disease of loneliness can be cured.
values.author: Kurt Vonnegut

values.authorQuote: Science is magic that works.
values.author: Kurt Vonnegut

values.authorQuote: To whom it may concern: It is springtime. It is late afternoon.
values.author: Kurt Vonnegut

values.authorQuote: Still and all, why bother? Here's my answer. Many people need desperately to receive this message: I feel and think much as you do, care about many of the things you care about, although most people do not care about them. You are not alone.
values.author: Kurt Vonnegut

values.authorQuote: The year was 2081, and everyone was finally equal.
values.author: Kurt Vonnegut

values.authorQuote: Like a welcome summer rain, humor may suddenly cleanse and cool the earth, the air and you.
values.author: Langston Hughes

values.authorQuote: Let the rain kiss you. Let the rain beat upon your head with silver liquid drops. Let the rain sing you a lullaby.
values.author: Langston Hughes

values.authorQuote: Hold fast to dreams, for if dreams die, life is a broken-winged bird that cannot fly.
values.author: Langston Hughes

values.authorQuote: Perhaps the mission of an artist is to interpret beauty to people - the beauty within themselves.
values.author: Langston Hughes

values.authorQuote: We Negro writers, just by being black, have been on the blacklist all our lives. Censorship for us begins at the color line.
values.author: Langston Hughes

values.authorQuote: In all my life, I have never been free. I have never been able to do anything with freedom, except in the field of my writing.
values.author: Langston Hughes

values.authorQuote: What happens to a dream deferred? Does it dry up Like a raisin in the sun? Or does it explode?
values.author: Langston Hughes

values.authorQuote: We younger Negro artists who create now intend to express our individual dark-skinned selves without fear or shame. If white people are pleased, we are glad. If they are not, it doesn't matter. We know we are beautiful. And ugly too.
values.author: Langston Hughes

values.authorQuote: Jazz, to me, is one of the inherent expressions of Negro life in America: the eternal tom-tom beating in the Negro soul - the tom-tom of revolt against weariness in a white world, a world of subway trains, and work, work, work; the tom-tom of joy and laughter, and pain swallowed in a smile.
values.author: Langston Hughes

values.authorQuote: Hold fast to dreams For when dreams go Life is a barren field Frozen with snow.
values.author: Langston Hughes

values.authorQuote: Beauty for some provides escape, who gain a happiness in eyeing the gorgeous buttocks of the ape or Autumn sunsets exquisitely dying.
values.author: Langston Hughes

values.authorQuote: An artist must be free to choose what he does, certainly, but he must also never be afraid to do what he might choose.
values.author: Langston Hughes

values.authorQuote: My soul has grown deep like the rivers.
values.author: Langston Hughes

values.authorQuote: I have discovered in life that there are ways of getting almost anywhere you want to go, if you really want to go.
values.author: Langston Hughes

values.authorQuote: When peoples care for you and cry for you, they can straighten out your soul.
values.author: Langston Hughes

values.authorQuote: Writing is like travelling. It's wonderful to go somewhere, but you get tired of staying.
values.author: Langston Hughes

values.authorQuote: I will not take 'but' for an answer.
values.author: Langston Hughes

values.authorQuote: To my mind, it is the duty of the younger Negro artist, if he accepts any duties at all from outsiders, to change through the force of his art that old whispering 'I want to be white,' hidden in the aspirations of his people, to 'Why should I want to be white? I am a Negro - and beautiful!'
values.author: Langston Hughes

values.authorQuote: I was a victim of a stereotype. There were only two of us Negro kids in the whole class, and our English teacher was always stressing the importance of rhythm in poetry. Well, everybody knows - except us - that all Negroes have rhythms, so they elected me class poet.
values.author: Langston Hughes

values.authorQuote: I swear to the Lord, I still can't see, why Democracy means, everybody but me.
values.author: Langston Hughes

values.authorQuote: Humor is laughing at what you haven't got when you ought to have it.
values.author: Langston Hughes

values.authorQuote: It's such a Bore Being always Poor.
values.author: Langston Hughes

values.authorQuote: My chief literary influences have been Paul Laurence Dunbar, Carl Sandburg, and Walt Whitman. My favorite public figures include Jimmy Durante, Marlene Dietrich, Mary McLeod Bethune, Mrs. Franklin D. Roosevelt, Marian Anderson, and Henry Armstrong.
values.author: Langston Hughes

values.authorQuote: I live in Harlem, New York City. I am unmarried. I like 'Tristan,' goat's milk, short novels, lyric poems, heat, simple folk, boats and bullfights; I dislike 'Aida,' parsnips, long novels, narrative poems, cold, pretentious folk, buses and bridges.
values.author: Langston Hughes

values.authorQuote: My writing has been largely concerned with the depicting of Negro life in America.
values.author: Langston Hughes

values.authorQuote: Violent anger makes me physically ill.
values.author: Langston Hughes

values.authorQuote: Being deeply loved by someone gives you strength, while loving someone deeply gives you courage.
values.author: Lao Tzu

values.authorQuote: The journey of a thousand miles begins with one step.
values.author: Lao Tzu

values.authorQuote: Do the difficult things while they are easy and do the great things while they are small. A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.
values.author: Lao Tzu

values.authorQuote: Kindness in words creates confidence. Kindness in thinking creates profoundness. Kindness in giving creates love.
values.author: Lao Tzu

values.authorQuote: A good traveler has no fixed plans, and is not intent on arriving.
values.author: Lao Tzu

values.authorQuote: Silence is a source of great strength.
values.author: Lao Tzu

values.authorQuote: Life is a series of natural and spontaneous changes. Don't resist them - that only creates sorrow. Let reality be reality. Let things flow naturally forward in whatever way they like.
values.author: Lao Tzu

values.authorQuote: Nothing is softer or more flexible than water, yet nothing can resist it.
values.author: Lao Tzu

values.authorQuote: When the best leader's work is done the people say, 'We did it ourselves.'
values.author: Lao Tzu

values.authorQuote: I have just three things to teach: simplicity, patience, compassion. These three are your greatest treasures.
values.author: Lao Tzu

values.authorQuote: If you do not change direction, you may end up where you are heading.
values.author: Lao Tzu

values.authorQuote: Life and death are one thread, the same line viewed from different sides.
values.author: Lao Tzu

values.authorQuote: The key to growth is the introduction of higher dimensions of consciousness into our awareness.
values.author: Lao Tzu

values.authorQuote: Knowing others is wisdom, knowing yourself is Enlightenment.
values.author: Lao Tzu

values.authorQuote: When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.
values.author: Lao Tzu

values.authorQuote: Mastering others is strength. Mastering yourself is true power.
values.author: Lao Tzu

values.authorQuote: A leader is best when people barely know he exists, when his work is done, his aim fulfilled, they will say: we did it ourselves.
values.author: Lao Tzu

values.authorQuote: To the mind that is still, the whole universe surrenders.
values.author: Lao Tzu

values.authorQuote: At the center of your being you have the answer; you know who you are and you know what you want.
values.author: Lao Tzu

values.authorQuote: Great acts are made up of small deeds.
values.author: Lao Tzu

values.authorQuote: Anticipate the difficult by managing the easy.
values.author: Lao Tzu

values.authorQuote: Violence, even well intentioned, always rebounds upon oneself.
values.author: Lao Tzu

values.authorQuote: An ant on the move does more than a dozing ox.
values.author: Lao Tzu

values.authorQuote: From caring comes courage.
values.author: Lao Tzu

values.authorQuote: He who controls others may be powerful, but he who has mastered himself is mightier still.
values.author: Lao Tzu

values.author: Lord Byron

values.authorQuote: The great art of life is sensation, to feel that we exist, even in pain.
values.author: Lord Byron

values.authorQuote: Sorrow is knowledge, those that know the most must mourn the deepest, the tree of knowledge is not the tree of life.
values.author: Lord Byron

values.authorQuote: Fools are my theme, let satire be my song.
values.author: Lord Byron

values.authorQuote: The busy have no time for tears.
values.author: Lord Byron

values.authorQuote: Between two worlds life hovers like a star, twixt night and morn, upon the horizon's verge.
values.author: Lord Byron

values.authorQuote: Those who will not reason, are bigots, those who cannot, are fools, and those who dare not, are slaves.
values.author: Lord Byron

values.authorQuote: Roll on, deep and dark blue ocean, roll. Ten thousand fleets sweep over thee in vain. Man marks the earth with ruin, but his control stops with the shore.
values.author: Lord Byron

values.authorQuote: Life's enchanted cup sparkles near the brim.
values.author: Lord Byron

values.authorQuote: But words are things, and a small drop of ink, Falling like dew, upon a thought, produces That which makes thousands, perhaps millions, think.
values.author: Lord Byron

values.authorQuote: Self-love for ever creeps out, like a snake, to sting anything which happens to stumble upon it.
values.author: Lord Byron

values.authorQuote: The 'good old times' - all times when old are good.
values.author: Lord Byron

values.authorQuote: Adversity is the first path to truth.
values.author: Lord Byron

values.authorQuote: A man of eighty has outlived probably three new schools of painting, two of architecture and poetry and a hundred in dress.
values.author: Lord Byron

values.authorQuote: Man, being reasonable, must get drunk; the best of life is but intoxication.
values.author: Lord Byron

values.authorQuote: Lovers may be - and indeed generally are - enemies, but they never can be friends, because there must always be a spice of jealousy and a something of Self in all their speculations.
values.author: Lord Byron

values.authorQuote: Man is born passionate of body, but with an innate though secret tendency to the love of Good in his main-spring of Mind. But God help us all! It is at present a sad jar of atoms.
values.author: Lord Byron

values.authorQuote: A woman who gives any advantage to a man may expect a lover but will sooner or later find a tyrant.
values.author: Lord Byron

values.authorQuote: For pleasures past I do not grieve, nor perils gathering near; My greatest grief is that I leave nothing that claims a tear.
values.author: Lord Byron

values.authorQuote: The Cardinal is at his wit's end - it is true that he had not far to go.
values.author: Lord Byron

values.authorQuote: I follow three rules: Do the right thing, do the best you can, and always show people you care.
values.author: Lou Holtz

values.authorQuote: Ability is what you're capable of doing. Motivation determines what you do. Attitude determines how well you do it.
values.author: Lou Holtz

values.authorQuote: Virtually nothing is impossible in this world if you just put your mind to it and maintain a positive attitude.
values.author: Lou Holtz

values.authorQuote: Winners embrace hard work. They love the discipline of it, the trade-off they're making to win. Losers, on the other hand, see it as punishment. And that's the difference.
values.author: Lou Holtz

values.authorQuote: Successful people will always tell you you can do something. It's the people who have never accomplished anything who will always discourage you from trying to achieve excellent things.
values.author: Lou Holtz

values.authorQuote: See, winners embrace hard work.
values.author: Lou Holtz

values.authorQuote: Everyone goes through adversity in life, but what matters is how you learn from it.
values.author: Lou Holtz

values.authorQuote: If what you did yesterday seems big, you haven't done anything today.
values.author: Lou Holtz

values.authorQuote: You aren't going to find anybody that's going to be successful without making a sacrifice and without perseverance.
values.author: Lou Holtz

values.authorQuote: The problem with having a sense of humor is often that people you use it on aren't in a very good mood.
values.author: Lou Holtz

values.authorQuote: Sacrifice, discipline and prayer are essential. We gain strength through God's word. We receive grace from the sacrament. And when we fumble due to sin - and it's gonna happen - confession puts us back on the field.
values.author: Lou Holtz

values.authorQuote: Do right. Do your best. Treat others as you want to be treated.
values.author: Lou Holtz

values.authorQuote: Don't tell your problems to people: eighty percent don't care; and the other twenty percent are glad you have them.
values.author: Lou Holtz

values.authorQuote: I was born January 6, 1937, eight years after Wall Street crashed and two years before John Steinbeck published The Grapes of Wrath, his Pulitzer Prize-winning novel about the plight of a family during the Great Depression.
values.author: Lou Holtz

values.authorQuote: The key to winning is choosing to do God's will and loving others with all you've got.
values.author: Lou Holtz

values.authorQuote: We can all be successful and make money, but when we die, that ends. But when you are significant is when you help other people be successful. That lasts many a lifetime.
values.author: Lou Holtz

values.authorQuote: Show me someone who has done something worthwhile, and I'll show you someone who has overcome adversity.
values.author: Lou Holtz

values.authorQuote: As a coach, one thing that used to frustrate me was one player would make a bad decision, and that's all you would read about in the papers all over the country. We have so many athletes do so many wonderful things for other people, and you never read about it.
values.author: Lou Holtz

values.authorQuote: At age nine, I got a paper route. Sixty-six papers had to be delivered to sixty-six families every day. I also had to collect thirty cents a week from each customer. I owed the paper twenty cents per customer per week, and got to keep the rest. When I didn't collect, the balance came out of my profit. My average income was six dollars a week.
values.author: Lou Holtz

values.authorQuote: Notre Dame is the one school that has a national recruiting base, from Florida to Texas to California.
values.author: Lou Holtz

values.authorQuote: In the nineties, everybody wants to talk about their rights and privileges. Twenty-five years ago, people talked about their obligations and responsibilities.
values.author: Lou Holtz

values.authorQuote: I can't believe that God put us on this earth to be ordinary.
values.author: Lou Holtz

values.authorQuote: You're never as good as everyone tells you when you win, and you're never as bad as they say when you lose.
values.author: Lou Holtz

values.authorQuote: I think that we have opportunities all around us - sometimes we just don't recognize them.
values.author: Lou Holtz

values.authorQuote: For victory in life, we've got to keep focused on the goal, and the goal is Heaven.
values.author: Lou Holtz

values.authorQuote: A lifetime contract for a coach means if you're ahead in the third quarter and moving the ball, they can't fire you.
values.author: Lou Holtz

values.authorQuote: Talking is always positive. That's why I talk too much.
values.author: Louis C. K.
values.authorOccupation: Comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, editor

values.authorQuote: I don't stop eating when I'm full. The meal isn't over when I'm full. It's over when I hate myself.
values.author: Louis C. K.
values.authorOccupation: Comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, editor

values.authorQuote: I'm bored' is a useless thing to say. You live in a great, big, vast world that you've seen none percent of.
values.author: Louis C. K.
values.authorOccupation: Comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, editor

values.authorQuote: There are people that really live by doing the right thing, but I don't know what that is, I'm really curious about that. I'm really curious about what people think they're doing when they're doing something evil, casually. I think it's really interesting, that we benefit from suffering so much, and we excuse ourselves from it.
values.author: Louis C. K.
values.authorOccupation: Comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, editor

values.authorQuote: Oh, I love stand-up.
values.author: Louis C. K.
values.authorOccupation: Comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, editor

values.authorQuote: It's a positive thing to talk about terrible things and make people laugh about them.
values.author: Louis C. K.
values.authorOccupation: Comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, editor

values.authorQuote: I wish I could know everything ever, like that would be my wish - that's what I hope heaven is, that they tell you who shot JFK and all that stuff.
values.author: Louis C. K.
values.authorOccupation: Comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, editor

values.authorQuote: I've met a lot of people who've lost their jobs and they still have a sense of humor.
values.author: Louis C. K.
values.authorOccupation: Comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, editor

values.authorQuote: Some entertainers don't pay attention to what's going on around them.
values.author: Louis C. K.
values.authorOccupation: Comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, editor

values.authorQuote: Breaking records is not something you expect to be doing. That's like a sports thing, it's not usually a comedy and writing thing.
values.author: Louis C. K.
values.authorOccupation: Comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, editor

values.authorQuote: I know what it's like to have a bunch of material that's working that you don't care about. You want to die.
values.author: Louis C. K.
values.authorOccupation: Comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, editor

values.authorQuote: Pushing the envelope' sort of implies that you're inside the envelope with everyone else, and you're trying to find the edges on the outsides.
values.author: Louis C. K.
values.authorOccupation: Comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, editor

values.authorQuote: Technically, I've learned that having good legs and wind is good for being on stage. You have to be in shape and have endurance.
values.author: Louis C. K.
values.authorOccupation: Comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, editor

values.authorQuote: I think I'm past any window where I'm suddenly going to become surprisingly ripped so that people go, 'Oh, my God, what happened to you?'
values.author: Louis C. K.
values.authorOccupation: Comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, editor

values.authorQuote: Everything that people say is testable.
values.author: Louis C. K.
values.authorOccupation: Comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, editor

values.authorQuote: It's more fun to experience things when you don't know what's going to happen.
values.author: Louis C. K.
values.authorOccupation: Comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, editor

values.authorQuote: I don't think women are better than men, I think men are a lot worse than women.
values.author: Louis C. K.
values.authorOccupation: Comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, editor

values.authorQuote: I've always loved boxing. It's something I've always been extremely excited about.
values.author: Louis C. K.
values.authorOccupation: Comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, editor

values.authorQuote: The only pitch I have to movie people is the same as this one: Just give me $8 million. I'm not telling you what it's about and I'm not telling you who's in it.
values.author: Louis C. K.
values.authorOccupation: Comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, editor

values.authorQuote: A lot of TV is put together by teams, by writing staffs and several different directors. It's a great, very smart way to make television. It's worked for however long TV's been around.
values.author: Louis C. K.
values.authorOccupation: Comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, editor

values.authorQuote: It's kind of awkward to eat alone in a restaurant because everybody's looking at me.
values.author: Louis C. K.
values.authorOccupation: Comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, editor

values.authorQuote: My ex-wife, she really didn't like the material that I did. And that's something I regret, that I wasn't more careful about making sure that she was O.K. with it. I just sort of didn't ask. So that's how that goes.
values.author: Louis C. K.
values.authorOccupation: Comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, editor

values.authorQuote: You can't cancel my stand-up tours. It's impossible. There's too many separate bosses. There is no 'bosses.'
values.author: Louis C. K.
values.authorOccupation: Comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, editor

values.authorQuote: I like pressure. Pressure doesn't make me crack. It's enabling. I eat pressure, and there might be times when I get a bad feeling in my gut that this might be too much, but you feel pressure when you're not doing something, you know?
values.author: Louis C. K.
values.authorOccupation: Comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, editor

values.authorQuote: The problem is, the more famous you get, the more people see you who didn't choose to.
values.author: Louis C. K.
values.authorOccupation: Comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, editor

values.authorQuote: To me, art supplies are always okay to buy.
values.author: Louis C. K.
values.authorOccupation: Comedian, actor, writer, producer, director, editor

values.authorQuote: Love yourself first and everything else falls into line. You really have to love yourself to get anything done in this world.
values.author: Lucille Ball
values.authorOccupation: Actress, comedian, model, film studio executive, TV producer

values.authorQuote: The secret of staying young is to live honestly, eat slowly, and lie about your age.
values.author: Lucille Ball
values.authorOccupation: Actress, comedian, model, film studio executive, TV producer

values.authorQuote: I'd rather regret the things I've done than regret the things I haven't done.
values.author: Lucille Ball
values.authorOccupation: Actress, comedian, model, film studio executive, TV producer

values.authorQuote: One of the things I learned the hard way was that it doesn't pay to get discouraged. Keeping busy and making optimism a way of life can restore your faith in yourself.

values.authorQuote: The more things you do, the more you can do.
values.author: Lucille Ball
values.authorOccupation: Actress, comedian, model, film studio executive, TV producer

values.authorQuote: I'm not funny. What I am is brave.
values.author: Lucille Ball
values.authorOccupation: Actress, comedian, model, film studio executive, TV producer

values.authorQuote: Once in his life, every man is entitled to fall madly in love with a gorgeous redhead.
values.author: Lucille Ball
values.authorOccupation: Actress, comedian, model, film studio executive, TV producer

values.authorQuote: I have an everyday religion that works for me. Love yourself first, and everything else falls into line.
values.author: Lucille Ball
values.authorOccupation: Actress, comedian, model, film studio executive, TV producer

values.authorQuote: If you want something done, ask a busy person to do it. The more things you do, the more you can do.
values.author: Lucille Ball
values.authorOccupation: Actress, comedian, model, film studio executive, TV producer

values.authorQuote: Luck? I don't know anything about luck. I've never banked on it and I'm afraid of people who do. Luck to me is something else: Hard work - and realizing what is opportunity and what isn't.

values.authorOccupation: Actress, comedian, model, film studio executive, TV producer

values.authorQuote: In life, all good things come hard, but wisdom is the hardest to come by.
values.author: Lucille Ball
values.authorOccupation: Actress, comedian, model, film studio executive, TV producer

values.authorQuote: I'm happy that I have brought laughter because I have been shown by many the value of it in so many lives, in so many ways.
values.author: Lucille Ball
values.authorOccupation: Actress, comedian, model, film studio executive, TV producer

values.authorQuote: Women's Lib? Oh, I'm afraid it doesn't interest me one bit. I've been so liberated it hurts.
values.author: Lucille Ball
values.authorOccupation: Actress, comedian, model, film studio executive, TV producer

values.authorQuote: I will never do another TV series. It couldn't top I Love Lucy, and I'd be foolish to try. In this business, you have to know when to get off.
values.author: Lucille Ball
values.authorOccupation: Actress, comedian, model, film studio executive, TV producer

values.authorQuote: Use a make-up table with everything close at hand and don't rush; otherwise you'll look like a patchwork quilt.

values.authorOccupation: Actress, comedian, model, film studio executive, TV producer

values.authorQuote: You see much more of your children once they leave home.
values.author: Lucille Ball
values.authorOccupation: Actress, comedian, model, film studio executive, TV producer

values.authorQuote: I think knowing what you cannot do is more important than knowing what you can.
values.author: Lucille Ball
values.authorOccupation: Actress, comedian, model, film studio executive, TV producer

values.authorQuote: I am a real ham. I love an audience. I work better with an audience. I am dead, in fact, without one.
values.author: Lucille Ball
values.authorOccupation: Actress, comedian, model, film studio executive, TV producer

values.authorQuote: I'm sometimes scared of everything that has happened to us. We didn't think Desilu Productions would grow so big. We merely wanted to be together and have two children.
values.author: Lucille Ball
values.authorOccupation: Actress, comedian, model, film studio executive, TV producer

values.authorQuote: It's a helluva start, being able to recognize what makes you happy.
values.author: Lucille Ball
values.authorOccupation: Actress, comedian, model, film studio executive, TV producer

values.authorQuote: I hate failure and that divorce was a Number One failure in my eyes. It was the worst period of my life. Neither Desi nor I have been the same since, physically or mentally.
values.author: Lucille Ball
values.authorOccupation: Actress, comedian, model, film studio executive, TV producer

values.authorQuote: How I Love Lucy was born? We decided that instead of divorce lawyers profiting from our mistakes, we'd profit from them.
values.author: Lucille Ball
values.authorOccupation: Actress, comedian, model, film studio executive, TV producer

values.authorQuote: Ability is of little account without opportunity.
values.author: Lucille Ball
values.authorOccupation: Actress, comedian, model, film studio executive, TV producer

values.authorQuote: I regret the passing of the studio system. I was very appreciative of it because I had no talent.
values.author: Lucille Ball
values.authorOccupation: Actress, comedian, model, film studio executive, TV producer

values.authorQuote: I dyed my hair this crazy red to bid for attention. It has become a trademark, and I've got to keep it this way.
values.author: Lucille Ball
values.authorOccupation: Actress, comedian, model, film studio executive, TV producer

values.authorQuote: I don't think you should write a book until you tell the absolute truth. You can't do that until you're 85, and I don't want to live that long. I've always prided myself on knowing when to get off, and I hope it works out that way.
values.author: Lucille Ball
values.authorOccupation: Actress, comedian, model, film studio executive, TV producer

values.authorQuote: One of the most beautiful qualities of true friendship is to understand and to be understood.
values.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

values.authorQuote: True happiness is... to enjoy the present, without anxious dependence upon the future.
values.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

values.authorQuote: All art is but imitation of nature.
values.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

values.authorQuote: Luck is a matter of preparation meeting opportunity.
values.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

values.authorQuote: It is a rough road that leads to the heights of greatness.
values.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

values.authorQuote: A gift consists not in what is done or given, but in the intention of the giver or doer.
values.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

values.authorQuote: Life's like a play: it's not the length, but the excellence of the acting that matters.
values.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

values.authorQuote: If one does not know to which port one is sailing, no wind is favorable.
values.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

values.authorQuote: Love in its essence is spiritual fire.
values.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

values.authorQuote: A happy life is one which is in accordance with its own nature.
values.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

values.authorQuote: A gem cannot be polished without friction, nor a man perfected without trials.
values.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

values.authorQuote: All cruelty springs from weakness.
values.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

values.authorQuote: As long as you live, keep learning how to live.
values.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

values.authorQuote: It is quality rather than quantity that matters.
values.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

values.authorQuote: Expecting is the greatest impediment to living. In anticipation of tomorrow, it loses today.
values.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

values.authorQuote: Religion is regarded by the common people as true, by the wise as false, and by the rulers as useful.
values.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

values.authorQuote: Shall I tell you what the real evil is? To cringe to the things that are called evils, to surrender to them our freedom, in defiance of which we ought to face any suffering.
values.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

values.authorQuote: While we are postponing, life speeds by.
values.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

values.authorQuote: For greed all nature is too little.
values.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

values.authorQuote: Life is the fire that burns and the sun that gives light. Life is the wind and the rain and the thunder in the sky. Life is matter and is earth, what is and what is not, and what beyond is in Eternity.
values.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

values.authorQuote: He who does not prevent a crime when he can, encourages it.
values.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

values.authorQuote: The way is long if one follows precepts, but short... if one follows patterns.
values.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

values.authorQuote: The pressure of adversity does not affect the mind of the brave man... It is more powerful than external circumstances.
values.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

values.authorQuote: It is not because things are difficult that we do not dare, it is because we do not dare that they are difficult.
values.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

values.authorQuote: Nothing is so wretched or foolish as to anticipate misfortunes. What madness is it to be expecting evil before it comes.
values.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

values.authorQuote: We are more often frightened than hurt; and we suffer more from imagination than from reality.
values.author: Lucius Annaeus Seneca

values.authorQuote: The human body is the best picture of the human soul.
values.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

values.authorQuote: If people never did silly things nothing intelligent would ever get done.
values.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

values.authorQuote: Whereof one cannot speak, thereof one must be silent.

values.authorQuote: Knowledge is in the end based on acknowledgement.
values.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

values.authorQuote: Not every religion has to have St. Augustine's attitude to sex. Why even in our culture marriages are celebrated in a church, everyone present knows what is going to happen that night, but that doesn't prevent it being a religious ceremony.
values.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

values.authorQuote: The limits of my language means the limits of my world.
values.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

values.authorQuote: A confession has to be part of your new life.
values.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

values.authorQuote: Like everything metaphysical the harmony between thought and reality is to be found in the grammar of the language.
values.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

values.authorQuote: Philosophy is like trying to open a safe with a combination lock: each little adjustment of the dials seems to achieve nothing, only when everything is in place does the door open.

values.authorQuote: Never stay up on the barren heights of cleverness, but come down into the green valleys of silliness.
values.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

values.authorQuote: One of the most misleading representational techniques in our language is the use of the word 'I.'

values.authorQuote: The world is independent of my will.
values.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

values.authorQuote: A serious and good philosophical work could be written consisting entirely of jokes.
values.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

values.authorQuote: I sit astride life like a bad rider on a horse. I only owe it to the horse's good nature that I am not thrown off at this very moment.
values.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

values.authorQuote: Nothing is so difficult as not deceiving oneself.
values.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

values.authorQuote: Logic takes care of itself; all we have to do is to look and see how it does it.
values.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

values.authorQuote: For a truly religious man nothing is tragic.
values.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

values.authorQuote: Our greatest stupidities may be very wise.

values.authorQuote: I don't know why we are here, but I'm pretty sure that it is not in order to enjoy ourselves.

values.authorQuote: Don't get involved in partial problems, but always take flight to where there is a free view over the whole single great problem, even if this view is still not a clear one.

values.authorQuote: Man has to awaken to wonder - and so perhaps do peoples. Science is a way of sending him to sleep again.

values.authorQuote: A man's thinking goes on within his consciousness in a seclusion in comparison with which any physical seclusion is an exhibition to public view.
values.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

values.authorQuote: A philosopher who is not taking part in discussions is like a boxer who never goes into the ring.
values.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

values.authorQuote: Death is not an event in life: we do not live to experience death. If we take eternity to mean not infinite temporal duration but timelessness, then eternal life belongs to those who live in the present.
values.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

values.authorQuote: The world is the totality of facts, not of things.
values.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

values.authorQuote: When one is frightened of the truth then it is never the whole truth that one has an inkling of.
values.author: Ludwig Wittgenstein

values.authorQuote: Yesterday is not ours to recover, but tomorrow is ours to win or lose.
values.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

values.authorQuote: Until justice is blind to color, until education is unaware of race, until opportunity is unconcerned with the color of men's skins, emancipation will be a proclamation but not a fact.

values.authorQuote: Every man has a right to a Saturday night bath.
values.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

values.authorQuote: I have learned that only two things are necessary to keep one's wife happy. First, let her think she's having her own way. And second, let her have it.
values.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

values.authorQuote: Our purpose in Vietnam is to prevent the success of aggression. It is not conquest, it is not empire, it is not foreign bases, it is not domination. It is, simply put, just to prevent the forceful conquest of South Vietnam by North Vietnam.
values.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

values.authorQuote: The atomic bomb certainly is the most powerful of all weapons, but it is conclusively powerful and effective only in the hands of the nation which controls the sky.
values.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

values.authorQuote: A President's hardest task is not to do what is right, but to know what is right.
values.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

values.authorQuote: There are no problems we cannot solve together, and very few that we can solve by ourselves.
values.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

values.authorQuote: We have the opportunity to move not only toward the rich society and the powerful society, but upward to the Great Society.
values.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

values.authorQuote: Jerry Ford is so dumb he can't fart and chew gum at the same time.
values.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

values.authorQuote: I once told Nixon that the Presidency is like being a jackass caught in a hail storm. You've got to just stand there and take it.
values.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

values.authorQuote: When the burdens of the presidency seem unusually heavy, I always remind myself it could be worse. I could be a mayor.
values.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

values.authorQuote: John F. Kennedy was the victim of the hate that was a part of our country. It is a disease that occupies the minds of the few but brings danger to the many.
values.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

values.authorQuote: A man can take a little bourbon without getting drunk, but if you hold his mouth open and pour in a quart, he's going to get sick on it.
values.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

values.authorQuote: We have talked long enough in this country about equal rights. It is time now to write the next chapter - and to write it in the books of law.
values.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

values.authorQuote: To conclude that women are unfitted to the task of our historic society seems to me the equivalent of closing male eyes to female facts.

values.authorQuote: Our numbers have increased in Vietnam because the aggression of others has increased in Vietnam. There is not, and there will not be, a mindless escalation.
values.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

values.authorQuote: The noblest search is the search for excellence.
values.author: Lyndon B. Johnson

values.authorQuote: The presidency has made every man who occupied it, no matter how small, bigger than he was; and no matter how big, not big enough for its demands.

values.authorQuote: When someone tells me about Malala, the girl who was shot by the Taliban - that's my definition for her - I don't think she's me. Now I don't even feel as if I was shot. Even my life in Swat feels like a part of history or a movie I watched. Things change. God has given us a brain and a heart which tell us how to live.

They have to move... We have seen the barbaric situation of the 21st century in Swat. So why should I be afraid now?
